trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with ITRP | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with ITRP | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use ITRP with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use ITRP with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ITRP.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ITRP.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A ITRP tenant
trans-unit.target: A ITRP tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ITRP will be able to single sign into the application at your ITRP company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ITRP will be able to single sign into the application at your ITRP company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ITRP
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ITRP

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ITRP.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ITRP.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type ITRP.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type ITRP.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select ITRP, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select ITRP, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ITRP</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ITRP</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ITRP with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ITRP with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for ITRP requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for ITRP requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the ITRP application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the ITRP application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to ITRP page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to ITRP page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the ITRP Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.ITRP.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the ITRP Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.ITRP.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at ITRP page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\ITRP.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at ITRP page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\ITRP.cer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your ITRP company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your ITRP company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ITRP</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ITRP</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Enable.
trans-unit.target: Click Enable.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ITRP dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Remote Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ITRP dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Remote Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ITRP dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SAML SSO URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ITRP dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SAML SSO URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Certificate Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Certificate Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ITRP, they must be provisioned into ITRP.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ITRP, they must be provisioned into ITRP.

trans-unit.source: In the case of ITRP, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of ITRP, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your ITRP tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your ITRP tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Records.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Records.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the popup menu, select People.
trans-unit.target: From the popup menu, select People.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add New Person (“+”).
trans-unit.target: Click Add New Person (“+”).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Add New Person dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add New Person dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Name, Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Type the Name, Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other ITRP user account creation tools or APIs provided by ITRP to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other ITRP user account creation tools or APIs provided by ITRP to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the ITRP **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the ITRP **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
